name: Path T Melanoma Larynx Supraglottic
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include an in situ category for mucosal melanoma tumors. Assign 88 and behavior code /2 for in situ tumors.

**Note 2:**  Mucosal melanomas are aggressive tumors, therefore, T1 and T2 are omitted as are Stages I and II. 

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available or for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.
footnotes: *T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
rows:
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not stated or unknown
Surgical resection of primary tumor done and extension not documented in patient record
Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa (mucosal disease)

Tumor confined to mucosa of supraglottis: 
    Supraglottis (one subsite):
        Aryepiglottic fold
        Arytenoid cartilage:
            Corniculate cartilage
            Cuneiform cartilage
        Epilarynx, NOS
        False cords:
            Ventricular bands
            Ventricular cavity
            Ventricular fold
        Infrahyoid epiglottis
        Laryngeal cartilage, NOS
        Laryngeal (posterior) surface of epiglottis
        Suprahyoid epiglottis (including tip, lingual {anterior} and laryngeal surfaces)
WITH normal vocal cord mobility

Extension involving mucosa only of glottic larynx or subglottis WITHOUT impaired vocal cord mobility or fixation of larynx or NOS

Extension involving mucosa only of adjacent regions(s) outside supraglottis including:    
    Mucosa of base of tongue
    Vallecula
    Medial wall of pyriform sinus
WITHOUT impaired vocal cord mobility or fixation of larynx or NOS

Stated as T3

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles

Stated as T4[NOS]

Tumor invades: 
     Deep soft tissue
     Cartilage
     Bone
     Overlying skin

Involvement of deep tissues of any structure in T3
Involvement of any structures in T3 WITH impaired vocal cord mobility
Involvement of any structures in supraglottic larynx and subglottic larynx WITH vocal cord fixation

Paraglottic space WITHOUT vocal cord fixation
Minor thyroid cartilage erosion (inner cortex) WITHOUT vocal cord fixation

Tumor involves further regions outside the supraglottis including:
    Deep tissues or musculature:
        Base of tongue
        Medial wall pyriform sinus
        Vallecula
    Hypopharynx, NOS
    Pre-epiglottic tissues
    Postcricoid area
    Pyriform sinus, NOS
WITH or WITHOUT vocal cord fixation
    
Extension to/through:
    Cricoid cartilage 
    Deep extrinsic muscles of tongue  
    Esophagus
    Oropharynx
    Skin
    Soft tissues of neck
    Strap muscle(s):
         Omohyoid
         Sternohyoid
         Sternothyroid
         Thyrohyoid
    Thyroid cartilage 
    Thyroid gland
    Trachea

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
    Brain
    Dura
    Skull base
    Lower cranial nerves (IX, X, XI, XII)
    Masticator space
    Carotid artery
    Prevertebral space
    Mediastinal structures

Contiguous extension, including:
    Carotid artery (encased)
    Mediastinal structures

Stated as T4b
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No pathologic evaluation of primary tumor
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of the highest T
Only positive biopsy of tumor which is not the highest T 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
